HComboBox

HComboBox is a control unit that is a combination of a pop-up-menu, a single-line textfield (textcontrol) and a combobox button.  A combobox allows the user type a value in the text field or click on the button (displays a drop-down list of non-editable options) and choose one of the several options.

Summary
HComboBox
HComboBox is a control unit that is a combination of a pop-up-menu, a single-line textfield (textcontrol) and a combobox button.
Instance variables
constructor
die
Destroys the pop-up menu before destroying the combo box.
draw
Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.
addItem
removeItem
The index of the object to remove.
selectItem
Selects the given menu item in this combo box.
selectItemAtIndex
Selects a menu item that is placed in the given index in this combo box.
selectedIndex
Returns the currently selected item’s index.
selectedItem
Returns the currently selected menu item.
selectedIndexChanged
Implemented by derived classes to do whatever they please when the selection on the combo box’s pop-up menu changes.

Instance variables

type’[HComboBox]’
valueNumeric value currently set to this object.
labelThe string that is shown as the label of this object.
popupMenuA reference to the menu object that holds the items of this combo box.
textControlA reference to the text control of this combo box.
comboBoxButtonA reference to the button that opens the pop-up menu.

Extends

HControl

See also

HControl HTextControl HPopupMenu HComboBoxButton

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_options(optional) All other parameters.  See HComponentDefaults.

die

die: function()

Destroys the pop-up menu before destroying the combo box.

See also

HControl.die

draw

draw: function()

Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.

See also

HView.draw

addItem

addItem: function(_label,
_index)
Adds an item to the combobox list at indexor, if no index is mentioned, to the end of the list.

Parameters

_labelA String object.
_indexThe index of the item, its ordinal position in the combobox.  Indices begin at 0.

removeItem

removeItem: function(_index)

The index of the object to remove.  All items beyond index are moved up one slot to fill the gap.

Parameters

_indexThe index of the item, its ordinal position in the combobox.  Indices begin at 0.

selectItem

selectItem: function(_item)

Selects the given menu item in this combo box.

Parameters

_itemA reference to a HMenuItem object that should be selected.

See also

HPopupMenu.selectItem

selectItemAtIndex

selectItemAtIndex: function(_index)

Selects a menu item that is placed in the given index in this combo box.

Parameters

_indexThe index of the menu item that should be selected.

See also

HPopupMenu.selectItemAtIndex

selectedIndex

selectedIndex: function()

Returns the currently selected item’s index.

Returns

The index of the menu item that is currently selected.  A negative number is returned if nothing is selected.

selectedItem

selectedItem: function()

Returns the currently selected menu item.  It is an instance of HMenuItem.

Returns

The menu item that is currently selected.  A null value is returned if nothing is selected.

selectedIndexChanged

selectedIndexChanged: function()

Implemented by derived classes to do whatever they please when the selection on the combo box’s pop-up menu changes.

See also

HPopupMenu.selectedIndexChanged

Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
HTextControl is a control unit that represents an editable input line of text.
HPopupMenu is a control unit that represents a menu typically used in isolation, rather than as part of an extensive menu hierarchy.
A HComboBoxButton object displays a labeled pop-up menu.
A Rect object represents a rectangle.
Define default setting here.
die: function()
Unregisters events before destroying the view.
draw: function()
Initializes the visual representation of the object, should call at least drawRect.
A HMenuItem object displays one item within a menu and contains the state associated with that item.
selectItem: function(_item)
Selects the given menu item in this pop-up menu.
selectItemAtIndex: function(_index)
Selects a menu item that is placed in the given index in this pop-up menu.
selectedIndexChanged: function()
Informs the owner object of changes in the selection on the pop-up menu.
